quoteFirst: Towards Steenstraate, too, the firing seemed to be dying down. I looked at my watch. It was
quoteLast: . This was the hour when as a rule our men began to feel hungry, and when in each troop the Chasseurs would set out, pannikin in hand, towards the smoking saucepan where the cook awaited them wielding his ladle with an important air.

quoteFirst: Escaped at last from the furnace his room was, and went to air in the streets; came home early and went to bed. This morning got up at
quoteLast: , and went to look out for some _columbaria_ I had heard of out of the Porta Pia, and near Santa Agnese. The drones at Santa Agnese knew nothing about them, but I met La Ferronays riding as I was returning in despair, and he showed me the way to them.

quoteFirst: Well, every Thursday Mother Bellflower came between
quoteLast: and seven in the morning, and went immediately into the linen-room and began to work. She was a tall, thin, bearded or rather hairy woman, for she had a beard all over her face, a surprising, an unexpected beard, growing in improbable tufts, in curly bunches which looked as if they had been sown by a madman over that great face, the face of a gendarme in petticoats.

quoteFirst: The first regular milk train was run on the 3d day of May, 1847. It ran morning and evening, leaving Otisville at
quoteLast: and 4.15 P. M., scheduled to reach New York at 11.30 A. M. and 9.15 P. M. Otisville continued to be the western terminus for the run of the milk train until 1868, when it was extended to Port Jervis.

quoteFirst: "You're a famous pedestrian in these days, Thorpe," I said, rising with a trifle of embarrassment from my seat as close to Miss Lenox's as the rocks permitted, "and an early riser too. When I got up this morning at
quoteLast: I told myself that I should see nobody for three hours at least, yet both Miss Lenox and you equal me in my love for the early morning hours."

quoteFirst: On April 2nd the Dervish army advanced against the British, their front extending for about 3 miles. The British formed an obtuse angle, and at
quoteLast: opened fire upon the advancing hosts with such precision that hundreds were mown down, but the Dervishes did not falter. As Steevens said, "No white troops could have faced that torrent for five minutes, but the Baggara and the blacks came on.

quoteFirst: The streets were left to people washing doorsteps; nobody was in full dress but the cavaliers upon the town-hall; they were all washed with dew, spruce in their gilding, and full of intelligence and a sense of professional responsibility. _Kling_ went they on the bells for the
quoteLast: as we went by. I took it kindly of them to make me this parting compliment; they never were in better form, not even at noon upon a Sunday.
